intro: Phyllanthus nothisii var. nothisii, commonly known as the African spurge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its succulent, ribbed stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in compact inflorescences, which are followed by green, fleshy fruits. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes, though its botanical properties are still under study.
